panels.description: -- DR2 - This query returns the number of cluster, hosts, vms and storage domains  in the latest datacenter configuration

targets.rawSql:
-- DR2 - This query returns the
-- number of cluster, hosts and vms
-- in the latest datacenter configuration

SELECT
    COUNT (
        DISTINCT v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id
    ) AS cluster_count,
    COUNT (
        DISTINCT v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id
    ) AS host_count,
    COUNT (
        DISTINCT v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id
    ) AS vm_count
FROM v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters
    LEFT OUTER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id =
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id
        )
    LEFT OUTER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_vms
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id =
            v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.cluster_id
        )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.datacenter_id =
    CAST ( '$datacenter_id' as UUID )

-- DR2- This query returns the total count of storage domains
-- for the chosen datacenter.

SELECT
    COUNT (
        DISTINCT v4_3_latest_map_datacenters_storage_domains.storage_domain_id
    ) AS storage_count
FROM v4_3_latest_map_datacenters_storage_domains
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_map_datacenters_storage_domains.datacenter_id =
    CAST ( '$datacenter_id' as UUID )

-- DR2 - This query returns the
-- number of cluster, hosts and vms
-- in the latest datacenter configuration

panels.description:
Calculates averages of CPU and memory percent for all hosts and averages the two values. The threshold are set to  60% and 80%.
This query is calculated from the host statistics samples view for the selected datacenter.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR11 - This query returns the
-- for the specific datacenter the average hosts
-- resources that  are not used ( cpu and memory )

SELECT
    100 -
    (
        cpu_usage_percent_avg +
        memory_usage_percent_avg
    ) /
    2
    AS average_resources_not_used
FROM (
    SELECT
        AVG ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_usage_percent_avg,
        AVG ( memory_usage_percent ) AS memory_usage_percent_avg
    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
        INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
            ON (
                v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters
            ON (
                v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id =
                v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we get only active hosts
        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
        -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
        AND v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.datacenter_id =
        CAST ( '$datacenter_id' AS UUID )
) AS average_resources

panels.title: Datacenter Host Resources Status (DR11)

panels.description:
Calculates average uptime percent for all hosts. Thresholds are set to 60% and 80%.
This query is calculated from the hosts' statistics samples view for the selected datacenter.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR5 - This query returns the uptime percent
-- of the hosts in the chosen datacenter

SELECT
    (
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) /
        SUM (
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
        )
    ) * 100
    AS uptime_mins_percent
FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
        )
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id =
            v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id
        )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.datacenter_id =
    CAST ( '$datacenter_id' as UUID )

panels.title: Datacenter Host Uptime Status (DR5)

panels.description: Calculates free disk size percent average of all storage domains attached to the datacenter from their latest sample. Thresholds are set to 60% and 80%.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR8 - This query returns the available disk size percent
-- of the storage domains in the chosen datacenter

SELECT
    (
        SUM (
            CAST ( available_disk_size_gb AS float )
        ) /
        SUM (
            CAST ( used_disk_size_gb AS float ) +
            CAST ( available_disk_size_gb AS float )
        )
    ) * 100
    AS free_disk_size_gb_percent
FROM storage_domain_samples_history
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_map_datacenters_storage_domains
        ON (
            storage_domain_samples_history.storage_domain_id =
            v4_3_latest_map_datacenters_storage_domains.storage_domain_id
        )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter the datacenter chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_map_datacenters_storage_domains.datacenter_id =
    CAST ( '$datacenter_id' AS UUID )
    -- Here we get the latest storage domains configuration
    AND storage_domain_samples_history.history_id IN (
        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
        FROM storage_domain_samples_history AS a
        GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id
    )

panels.title: Datacenter Storage Space Status (DR8)

panels.description: -- DR21 - This query returns for the top 5 busiest clusters, the max and average cpu and memory usage percent.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR21 - This query returns for the top 5 busiest clusters,
-- the max and average cpu and memory usage percent.

SELECT
--    v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_name,
    AVG ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_usage_percent_avg,
    MAX ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_usage_percent_max,
    AVG ( memory_usage_percent ) AS memory_usage_percent_avg,
    MAX ( memory_usage_percent ) AS memory_usage_percent_max
FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
        )
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id =
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id
        )
WHERE
    -- Here we get only active hosts
    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
    -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
    AND v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.datacenter_id =
    CAST ( '$datacenter_id' as UUID )
GROUP BY
    v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_name
ORDER BY
    AVG ( cpu_usage_percent ) +
    MAX ( cpu_usage_percent ) +
    AVG ( memory_usage_percent ) +
    MAX ( memory_usage_percent ) DESC
LIMIT 5

panels.title: Datacenter Top Five Busiest Clusters (DR21)

panels.description: -- DR16 - This query returns for the 5 clusters with the most downtime, the uptime, planned downtime and unplanned downtime percent.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR16 - This query returns for the 5 clusters with the most downtime,
-- the uptime, planned downtime and unplanned downtime percent.

SELECT
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_name,
    (
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
                    THEN
                        coalesce (
                            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) /
        SUM (
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
        )
    ) * 100
    AS uptime_percent,
    (
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 2
                    THEN
                        coalesce (
                            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) /
        SUM (
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
        )
    ) * 100
    AS planned_downtime_percent,
    (
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 3
                    THEN
                        coalesce (
                            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) /
        SUM (
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
        )
    ) * 100
    AS unplanned_downtime_percent
FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
        )
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id =
            v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id
        )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter the datacenter chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.datacenter_id =
    CAST ( '$datacenter_id' AS UUID )
GROUP BY
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_name
ORDER BY
    uptime_percent ASC,
    unplanned_downtime_percent DESC,
    planned_downtime_percent DESC
LIMIT 5

panels.title: Datacenter Top Five Clusters Host Downtime (DR16)

panels.description: -- DR26 - This query returns, for the  5 storage domains with the lowest available disk space, the available disk size, used disk size and available disk size percent.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR26 - This query returns, for the  5 storage domains
-- with the lowest available disk space, the available disk size,
-- used disk size and available disk size percent.

SELECT
    v4_3_latest_configuration_storage_domains.storage_domain_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
    available_disk_size_gb,
    used_disk_size_gb,
    (
        SUM (
            CAST ( available_disk_size_gb AS float )
        ) /
        SUM (
            CAST ( used_disk_size_gb AS float ) +
            CAST ( available_disk_size_gb AS float )
        )
    ) * 100
    AS free_disk_size_gb_percent
FROM storage_domain_samples_history
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_map_datacenters_storage_domains
        ON (
            storage_domain_samples_history.storage_domain_id =
            v4_3_latest_map_datacenters_storage_domains.storage_domain_id
            )
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_storage_domains
        ON (
            storage_domain_samples_history.storage_domain_id =
            v4_3_latest_configuration_storage_domains.storage_domain_id
        )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter the datacenter chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_map_datacenters_storage_domains.datacenter_id =
    CAST ( '$datacenter_id' AS UUID )
    -- Here we get the latest storage domains configuration
    AND storage_domain_samples_history.history_id IN (
        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
        FROM storage_domain_samples_history AS a
        GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id
    )
GROUP BY
    v4_3_latest_configuration_storage_domains.storage_domain_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
    available_disk_size_gb,
    used_disk_size_gb
ORDER BY
    SUM (
        CAST ( available_disk_size_gb AS float )
    ) /
    SUM (
        CAST ( used_disk_size_gb AS float ) +
        CAST ( available_disk_size_gb AS float )
    ) ASC
LIMIT 5

panels.title: Datacenter Top Five Used Storage Domain (DR26)

panels.description: -- DR27 - This query returns the hosts Average Usage Peaks per cluster in the chosen datacenter

targets.rawSql:
-- DR27 - This query returns the hosts Average Usage Peaks
-- per cluster in the chosen datacenter

SELECT
    --cluster_id,
    now() AS "time",
    cluster_name,
    AVG ( cpu_peak ) AS "Avg. CPU Peak",
    AVG ( mem_peak ) AS "Avg. Memory Peak"
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id,
        v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_name,
        v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
        MAX ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_peak,
        MAX ( memory_usage_percent ) AS mem_peak
    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
        INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
            ON (
                v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters
            ON (
                v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id =
                v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active hosts only
        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
        -- Here we filter the datacenter chosen by the user
        AND v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.datacenter_id =
        CAST ( '1529a0b4-e7bb-49b8-bf27-318b6718671a'  AS UUID )
        
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id,
        v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_name,
        v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
        DATE_PART (
            'hour',
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.history_datetime
        )
) AS TBL_samples_PEAKS
GROUP BY
    cluster_id,
    cluster_name

panels.title: Datacenter Summary of Cluster Hosts Resources Usage (DR27)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_latest_configuration_datacenters
list.label: Data Center
